intro: Kniphofia zombensis, commonly known as the zombie grass or firecracker lily, is a striking member of the Hemerocallidaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and its showy, clustered inflorescences that resemble torches, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant produces numerous small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and vibrant colors, it is a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
